net.big_oh.postoffice
Class PostOfficeServiceFactory

java.lang.Object
  net.big_oh.postoffice.PostOfficeServiceFactory

public class PostOfficeServiceFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Provides static factory methods for constructing concrete instances of IPostOfficeService using Properties files/objects to define service attributes.

Version:
Jun 1, 2010
See Also:
IPostOfficeService

Field Summary
static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> MANDATORY_PROPERTY_KEYS
          The property keys included in this collection define the minimum set of keys that must be passed to the getInstance() and getInstance(Properties) methods.
static java.lang.String PROPERTIES_FILE_NAME
          The name of the properties file that, by default, will be used to build new PostOffice instances.
static java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY_AUTHENTICATE_WITH_TLS
          By associating a value of 'true' with this key, you can request that the secure TLS protocol be used when authenticating to the outgoing SMTP mail server.
static java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY_DEBUG
          Enable to log debug output generated by the JavaMail API.
static java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY_FROM
          The "from" address for all email messages sent from the PostOffice instance.
static java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY_HOST
          The hostname of the SMTP server that will be used to route out-bound email messages.
static java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY_PORT
          The port on which the outgoing SMTP server is listening for connections.
static java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY_SMTP_PASSWORD
          The password for SMTP authentication.
static java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY_SMTP_USER_NAME
          The username for SMTP authentication.
static java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY_TRANSPORT_WITH_SSL
          By associating a value of 'true' with this key, you can request that email messages be transported using the secure SSL protocol.

PROPERTIES_FILE_NAME

public static final java.lang.String PROPERTIES_FILE_NAME
The name of the properties file that, by default, will be used to build new PostOffice instances.

PROPERTY_KEY_TRANSPORT_WITH_SSL

public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY_TRANSPORT_WITH_SSL
By associating a value of 'true' with this key, you can request that email messages be transported using the secure SSL protocol.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PROPERTY_KEY_AUTHENTICATE_WITH_TLS

public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY_AUTHENTICATE_WITH_TLS
By associating a value of 'true' with this key, you can request that the secure TLS protocol be used when authenticating to the outgoing SMTP mail server.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PROPERTY_KEY_SMTP_USER_NAME

public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY_SMTP_USER_NAME
The username for SMTP authentication. If you supply a username, you should also supply a password.

See Also:
PROPERTY_KEY_SMTP_PASSWORD, Constant Field Values

PROPERTY_KEY_SMTP_PASSWORD

public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY_SMTP_PASSWORD
The password for SMTP authentication. If you supply a password, you should also supply a username.

See Also:
PROPERTY_KEY_SMTP_USER_NAME, Constant Field Values

MANDATORY_PROPERTY_KEYS

public static final java.util.Set<java.lang.String> MANDATORY_PROPERTY_KEYS
The property keys included in this collection define the minimum set of keys that must be passed to the getInstance() and getInstance(Properties) methods.

Constructor Detail

PostOfficeServiceFactory

public PostOfficeServiceFactory()
Method Detail

getInstance

public static IPostOfficeService getInstance()
A convenience wrapper around getInstance(Properties). Calling this method is equivalent to: PostOfficeServiceFactory.getInstance(PostOfficeServiceFactory.readDefaultPostOfficeProperties())

Returns:
an instance of IPostOfficeService constructed from the properties file defined in the PROPERTIES_FILE_NAME file.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if no properties file named PROPERTIES_FILE_NAME can be resolved from the class path.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the properties file at PROPERTIES_FILE_NAME does not contain all mandatory property keys as defined in MANDATORY_PROPERTY_KEYS.
See Also:
PROPERTIES_FILE_NAME, MANDATORY_PROPERTY_KEYS

getInstance

public static IPostOfficeService getInstance(java.util.Properties postOfficeProperties)
Parameters:
postOfficeProperties - The properties to be used in constructing the new PostOffice instance.
Returns:
an instance of IPostOfficeService constructed from the details provided in the postOfficeProperties parameter.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the postOfficeProperties argument is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if postOfficeProperties does not contain all mandatory property keys as defined in MANDATORY_PROPERTY_KEYS.
See Also:
MANDATORY_PROPERTY_KEYS

readDefaultPostOfficeProperties

public static java.util.Properties readDefaultPostOfficeProperties()
Returns:
a Properties object populated from the properties file located at PROPERTIES_FILE_NAME.
